name: Barcelo Sants

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel from a sunday to a tuesday. We were checked in straight away by friendly staff. Our room was very basic. Bathroom was a good size. However it was good value for money at £55 per night. The hotel was a little out of the way for going out and about to anywhere interesting! It was above the train station however we found it difficult to navigate the train timetables. Woudl recommend for cheap and cheerful!
reviews.title: Good Value for money

reviews.text: We paid 129$ a night. Nice hotel. You can take a taxi to many places. Right below there is train station you can get access to the city and other places. Taxi cost about 15 euros. Monserat is a place to see (45 min train ride). Like any other hotel, bit expensive drinks & food.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, but outside main action scene (yet accessible)

reviews.text: Three females travelled from Dublin on 9th December to Barcelona. I had got the name of the hotel on the internet. I made a mistake and thought it was beside Placa Catalunya - however it was only 1 stop from their by train. The hotel is 20 minutes from the airport. A double room for 4 nights cost €300 - excellent value - I had a room to myself for the same cost. We took a trip to Sitges - just by walking down stairs to the station. It is also the main station to many other destinations in Spain. The hotel staff were very friendly. Breakfast was fit for a King - at €12 to dine in style was good value. However, evening dinner was neither good value nor good food ! I would recommend this hotel for a cheap place to stay - it seems to be mainly business people and was quite empty on the weekend - we stayed Saturday to Wednesday. All in all a good experience.
reviews.title: Very 80` style !

likes.liked: — Convenience to airport and main attractions of Barcelona
likes.disliked: — That there was no swimming pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My hubby & I stayed for 4 nights in this hotel in Barcelona & one night in Apsis Splendid. As a tourist, I have to say that it was more suited to Business folks because it could have been a hotel in just about any city in the world. Not Spain. There was absolutely no character in this hotel. However, on the other hand the rooms are comfortable, clean, spacious & its above the train station. So you can easily get just about anywhere by train or metro. Walking is also an option but have comfy shoes for this city.
reviews.title: Business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful & gave plenty of advice. We did our own breakfast rather than eat in house as I heard it was not up to scratch. They have internet for a small price, a bar that looks inviting & lots of lifts.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location

reviews.text: - Hotel in station good. After travelling 8hrs from Toulouse by train, being able to exit train area and walk up to hotel elevator very comforting. Didn't have to bother with taxis
reviews.title: Great Location

great location..
reviews.text: - Decent desk help. Most staff that I had to talk to was helpful and/or polite regardless if they had trouble understanding English

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Barcelo Hotel Sants literally sits right on top of the main train station in Barcelona. It was very convenient, considering the train from the airport comes right here and there is a metro station here too that takes you right into the heart of the city. There is a good tourist information booth within the train station too.
reviews.title: Nice, business hotel right above the train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a stairwell & elevator in the train station that goes right up to the hotel. USE IT! We missed it and almost got our stuff stolen outside the station by a pair of scam artists who threw a yellow, watery mixture on my travel pack and offered to clean it for me. Also beware of pickpockets!
reviews.title: Disappointing but good value for the price

likes.disliked: — Old looking decoration and disappointing breakfast

reviews.title: The Best Holiday I've Had
reviews.text: The hotel itself is a very nice, big business hotel with all the amenities. It lacks the charm of staying in the center of the city, but the rooms are very clean and the price is good (about 100 Euros for a double room). It is very comfortable and surprisingly quiet, considering it is so close to the trains.

reviews.title: A Safe Bet
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night while on holiday on the Costa Brava. We booked this hotel as it was recommended by a friend from Barcelona and was one of the only decent looking places for less than 250 euros.

reviews.title: Excellent Location
reviews.text: The handy access from the station is good but not well signposted so you can walk in a circle trying to find it! This entrance closes however at 12pm and the only other way in we saw was up some steep metal stairs which looked like they'd be a nightmare if you'd had a few cavas in town. The Bus Touristic also stops right outside on it's blue line which was handy, although the bus was packed every time it came past and we couldn't always get on the first one that came. This bus also only runs until 8pm, when it changes into a nighttime tour that you have to pay again for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only good thing for this hotel was its location right on top of the train station. Other than that, 'nothing special' was already a very good comment to the hotel.
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else unless you have to travel frequently by train

likes.liked: — The location is good with regard to train station only. The hotel is not close to major tourist attractions.

reviews.text: This was the worst hotel in my two weeks trip in Spain. Bad smell inside our room and our bathtub was blocked by a used soap (It was a nightmare when I picked up the soap, left by the previous guest, as I thought it was the plug)!!!! The room was very dated, and to be precise, the whole hotel was very dated.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay!

reviews.text: It was the Barcelona biannual festival when we stayed at the hotel. We asked the front desk for information on the festival and their answer was that they didn't know anything about the festival.
reviews.title: perfect location

reviews.text: The internet corner was not free. People was allowed to smoke in the lobby.
reviews.title: Quality Stay!

reviews.text: Although the room rate was not expensive, not cheap either. Money could be better spent in other hotel.
reviews.title: Positive stay

description: The new Barceló Sants hotel is now ready, having been totally reformed. Prepare to enjoy a unique stay in the 378 completely refurbished Orbital Rooms. Situated above Sants station, the hotel has direct access to the AVE, to the metro lines and theBarcelona railway. This unrivalled location gives guests easy access to both the city of Barcelona and also to the surrounding area. It is the best connected hotel in the city. It is also ideal for business trips thanks to its direct links to the airport. There is also 2500 m2 divided into 14 rooms for events and congresses, a showroom for exhibiting vehicles and products on a large scale with capacity for up to 1,500 people. Also worth highlighting is the close proximity to the Barcelona and Montjuic Trade Fair and Congress Centre, the 200 parking spaces, freeWi-Fi service, the Orbital Bar and the excellent cuisine served in its restaurants. Welcome on board for an imaginary voyage through this stellar hotel. It's the perfect launching pad for your voyage.
